meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a swain.
meanings.sent1: The swainish attire of the farmer made him look rustic.
meanings.sent2: The cozy cabin had a swainish charm that reminded me of the countryside.
meanings.sent3: The swainish hat on the scarecrow made the birds laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her swainish smile lit up the room with warmth and kindness.
meanings.sent5: The swainish aroma of freshly baked bread filled the kitchen with comfort.

meanings.definition: Behaving in a coarse or uncouth manner, like a swain.
meanings.sent1: His swainish behavior at the party embarrassed his friends.
meanings.sent2: The rowdy group's swainish antics disrupted the peaceful event.
meanings.sent3: The swainish jokes he told were met with awkward silence.
meanings.sent4: Her swainish manners clashed with the elegant setting of the ballroom.
meanings.sent5: The swainish language he used was not appropriate for the formal occasion.
